project_description: A simple Flutter application using the Cubit pattern for state management with a login screen and a home screen.
architecture_overview: The project follows a layered architecture, splitting the code into presentation, cubits, and models layers. The presentation layer contains screens and widgets, the cubits layer contains Cubit classes for state management, and the models layer contains the data models.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen: Enter email and password
LoginScreen -> AuthCubit: login(email, password)
AuthCubit -> AuthState: Emit authenticated state
AuthState -> HomeScreen: Navigate to home screen
User -> HomeScreen: Click logout button
HomeScreen -> AuthCubit: logout()
AuthCubit -> AuthState: Emit unauthenticated state
AuthState -> LoginScreen: Navigate to login screen
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AuthCubit handles the authentication state, emitting different states such as authenticated and unauthenticated. The UI listens to these state changes and updates accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. When the user logs out, they are navigated back to the LoginScreen.
